entry.title: How to Stay Safe from Cyber Attacks: Tips Anyone Can Follow
entry.summary: Cyber attacks are not just for big companies or tech experts anymore. Hackers are getting smarter, and everyday internet users are now regular targets. But here's the good news: you donâ€™t need to be a cybersecurity expert to protect yourself online. In this guide, Iâ€™ll walk you through simple, beginner-friendly steps that anyone can follow to stay safe from cyber attacksâ€”whether you're a small business owner, student, blogger, or just someone who uses the internet daily. Cyber threats are everywhere. From phishing emails to ransomware attacks, the digital world can be risky if you're not careful. A single wrong click could lead to data loss, identity theft, or worse. Thatâ€™s why understanding cyber threat intelligence is a smart moveâ€”even for non-techies. This sounds basic, but it's your fiâ€¦

entry.title: Cybersecurity for Beginners: How to Get Started in 2025
entry.summary: Starting your cybersecurity journey in 2025 can feel overwhelmingâ€”but it doesnâ€™t have to be. Whether you're a student, tech enthusiast, or someone just curious about how to protect your digital life, this guide is here to make things simple and easy to follow. So, letâ€™s break it down step by step and help you take that first confident step into the world of cybersecurity. Cybersecurity is the practice of protecting your devices, data, and networks from digital attacks. These attacks can come in many formsâ€”malware, phishing, ransomware, or even insider threats. Think of cybersecurity as your digital shield. To dive deeper into this concept, you can also check out this post on IT security and computer security. Everything is connected onlineâ€”from banking to shopping to chatting. That means mâ€¦

entry.title: iOS 18.4 Simulator Error
entry.summary: TL: DR Background I am working on an iOS app that uses Firebase Hosting for my json files and images, I want to load the data and cache them in SwiftData. In the beginning I thought Firebase Hosting works great for me, simple firebase deploy is all that needed to keep the files updated, no more git commits for Github pages where I used to store the files. But, there can be problem with Firebase Hosting CDN caching the files, so it is best the set firebase no-cache. Then in my iPhone 16 Pro iOS 18.4 simulator, I noticed that the json data could not be parsed. I tried with several simulators of iOS 18.4, all have the same problem. But there is no problem of fetching and parsing data when I use a physical iPhone with iOS 18.4. Research Later I find out that this is a known issue with the latest macOS and iOS simulators, especially with Xcode 15.3+ and macOS Sonoma. My simulator logs show: Solution So now I stick with the iPhone 12 Pro simulator on iOS 18.0 while Apple and Firebase resolve the instability on newer platforms.

entry.title: Best Way to Learn TypeScript & JavaScript for Playwright in Test Automation
entry.summary:
Hello all, I am mahesh career changer from chef to IT ! I'm new to programming and currently working in test automation. At my job, I'm using Playwright for UI testing, and I want to learn TypeScript/JavaScript properly to understand the framework better and improve my automation skills. Right now, I feel like I know enough to get scripts running, but I want to go deeperâ€”writing clean test code, handling async operations effectively, and understanding best practices for working with Playwright. One of the biggest challenges I face is debugging. Sometimes tests fail due to timing issues, flaky selectors, or unexpected behaviors, and I want to improve my debugging skills. I also want to strengthen my fundamental programming concepts in TypeScript, such as: Variables & Data Types (understanding type safety) Functions & Async/Await (handling asynchronous operations efficiently) Object-oriented programming (using classes and interfaces in test automation) Best debugging techniques (breakpoints, logging, step-by-step execution in VS Code) So, Iâ€™d love to hear from you: What are the best learning resources for TypeScript and JavaScript, especially for test automation?
Any Playwright-specific tutorials that helped you master the framework?
Best debugging techniques and tools for working with Playwright scripts?
How did you bridge the gap between using Playwright at work and actually understanding the framework in-depth?
Thanks in advance for your insights! Looking forward to learning from this community. ðŸš€

entry.title: Corpus & Vocabulary
entry.summary:
Corpus is collection of text. This can multiple paragraphs to entire book. Now question arises why we talking about? Well in Natural Processing Language there could be multiple paragraph For text analysis you need to remember this steps or preprocessing of corpus: Tokenisation Stop Word Removal Special Character Removal Converting LowerCase 1. Tokenisation 2. Stop Word Removal and Converting Lower Case: 3. Put in List: 4. Unique Words: Vocabulary in context of nlp, refers to unique words in corpus. After preprocessing total unique words. To see the difference after Stop Word Removal and getting Unique value from words
print(len(words)) print(len(set(words)))
Output: 49 41

entry.title: Sibling Relation Transitivity and a Little More
Next.js: getStaticProps, getServerSideProps, useEffect???
entry.summary: I'm creating a Next.js web app where users can create private logs and attach tags to them. These logs are displayed initally on the main page, and when a new one is added, the page updates automatically. I ran into the question; how do I fetch all of the existing data from the database and display them to the user with Next.js? Next offered a couple of function options (getStaticProps, getServerSideProps) and I finally landed on a regular React one (useEffect) after some trial and error. I started with getStaticProps first just to make sure my fetching funcationality was working. getStaticProps from next docs: The data required to render the page is available at build time ahead of a userâ€™s request The data comes from a headless CMS The page must be pre-rendered (for SEO) and be very faâ€¦

entry.title: Beyond Averages
entry.summary: In an era shaped by rapid technological leaps, shifting geopolitics, and intensifying climate challenges, the concept of the "average citizen" no longer reflects reality. Society is vibrant, complex, nuancedâ€”a rich tapestry woven from countless unique experiences. Governing effectively today calls for genuine responsiveness, adaptable thinking, and a profound commitment to equity and empathy. Looking closely, beneath broad statistics and reassuring averages, we find vast disparities. Healthcare inequality, economic shifts, AI ethics, and mental healthcare struggles all demand attentionâ€”but more importantly, understanding. To build resilience, we must move beyond surface-level answers and connect deeply with the lives these policies affect. How do we do this meaningfully, practically, and câ€¦
